alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Castro; Cochran; Hockley; Lamb; Parmer; Yoakum (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 4:21AM CDT until March 30 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE AND THE WESTERN SOUTH PLAINS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 10 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE AND THE WESTERN SOUTH PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 9 AM to 10 PM CDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. Timing...Noon to 10 PM CDT on Thursday. 9 AM to 10 PM CDT on Friday. * Wind...Southwest at 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph on Thursday. West at 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph on Friday. * Humidity...As low as 7 percent on Thursday. As low as 8 percent on Friday. * Fuels...Critically Dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Bailey; Castro; Cochran; Hockley; Lamb; Parmer; Yoakum
